issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Studio
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Titanium Studio here.

fields.description:
see the image below. 
***I WOULD CLASSIFY THIS AS CRITICAL***

Every time I install Appcelerator studio on windows 8.1 and then reboot the computer. 
When I try to relaunch Appcelerator studio I get this error.

Please note, that if I uninstall and re install Appcelerator Studio and then run it. Everything works.
However, if I then reboot. I get this issue.

I am running windows on bootcamp on a 2011 iMac. This point shouldn't matter, but too much data is better than not enough.
fields.summary: Appcelerator Studio can't find CLI executable everytime I reboot

comments.body: [~sophrinix] If you drop to the command line, do you see the CLI? Is it only Studio that can't find it?

I am unable to reproduce this, using:

Studio 4.0.0.201505202026
Appc NPM 4.0.0-rc
Appc CLI 4.0.0
Windows 8.1 & 8.0

After a fresh install of Studio and a reboot, Studio is able to launch without error

it doesn't find npm.

However powershell does (usually).

I'm rebooting windows again. I'll try to get a screencast video only to you
I don't see this issue on standalone windows 8.1 machine, might be very specific to "Windows on a Mac with Bootcamp".

[~codexlabs] Can you please provide the below logs for further analysis.Please enable troubleshootting option from preferences before you do this.
This can find in Appcelerator Studio-> Preferences-> Studio-> TroubleShooting-> Select 'Debug Level' to 'All'-> Click 'Ok'

1. Diagnostic Log: You can find in _Help-> Studio -> Run Diagnostic Test_
2. Workspace Log: You can find in _Help-> Studio -> View Log File_

After restarting studio, please capture these information.

1. Look in windows registry for_ "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Node.js”_ key with value “_InstallPath_"
2. Is node.exe located in Program Files ?
_Program Files (x86)\nodejs\node.exe_
_Program Files\nodejs\node.exe_

3. Are you able to locate appcelerator.cmd file in user AppData directory. For example, C:\Users\Admin\AppData\Roaming\npm\appcelerator.cmda
_%APPDATA%\\npm\\appcelerator.cmd_

Hello [~sophrinix], are you still facing this error in latest studio build 4.3.0. if so, can you manually install CLI in command prompt 

Run,
"npm install appcelerator -g"

"appc setup"

Reply with your findings, Thanks.

I don't have reliable access to the windows instance that created this behavior. :-/ 

If there isn't anyone else having this issue then go ahead and close it.
TISTUD-7781 should have fixed this issue.
